title: What are good songs that combine acoustic and electric guitar? - Quora

response.answer_text: I've been waiting for such a question for a while now.My favorite songs that combine acoustic/electric guitar are theseSkid Row: I Remember youBon Jovi: Wanted Dead or Alive, Blaze of GloryLed Zepellin: Ramble On, Babe I'm Gonna Leave You, The Rain SongTenacious D: Tribute, Kickapoo, BeelzebossGuns N' Roses: Dead Horse, I used to love her, One in a millionPearl Jam: Sirens, OceansPink Floyd: Wish You Were HereBoston: More Than a Feeling, Peace of MindThe Eagles: Hotel CaliforniaMetallica: Fade to BlackOasis: WonderwallThe Cranberries - ZombieNickelback - Photograph, Savin Me, Rockstar, Someday, If Today Was Your Last Day,Never Gonna Be Alone (wow that was too much Nickelback for some reason)4 Non Blondes - What's UpThe Fray: How to Save a Life, You Found Me, Heartless, Never Say NeverGreen Day: Boulevard of Broken Dreams Red Hot Chili Peppers: Desecration Smile, Wet Sand Goo Goo Dolls - Iris, Slide, Black Balloon, Name, Here Is Gone, Better DaysKings Of Leon - Beautiful War, Milk, Knocked Up, Cold Desert (you can't distinguish the acoustic guitar in these songs very much though)Poison: Every Rose Has It's Thorn Deep Purple: Soldier of Fortune And i left the best one for the end because that's my favorite song Alannah Myles - Black Velvet

My recommendation has to be Napoleon Solo by At The Drive-In.   At The Drive-In - Napoleon Solo This song is so fucking awesome that I just had to learn the tab myself. For both guitars. Only slightly obsessive of me. Lyonel Perabo was actually the one who introduced me to the song in one of his answers. We talked a bit in the comments, and he encouraged me to try the rest of the album, which I've listened to dozens of times at this point. Thanks a ton again, Lyonel! If you enjoyed the song, check out the rest of In/Cansino/Out and if you're feeling the drive (slaps knee), Relationship of Command as well. A better album overall, I think, but nothing can beat this track. Both albums share the same acoustic-electric dynamic, though. The band actually broke up a couple years ago, (with the lead singer and guitarist forming The Mars Volta, another awesome band) but got back together for another tour going on through 2016. You can check out tickets here: At the Drive-In Be warned, though, they're selling out fast. The shows near me are already gonzo.
